doc.ContractDescription: PHYLLOSILICATES OF THE NORTHERN LOWLANDS: IMPLICATIONS FOR AQUEOUS ALTERATION ON MARS SINCE THEIR FORMATION EARLY IN MARS HISTORY, THE NORTHERN LOWLANDS HAVE SERVED AS A DEPOSITIONAL CENTER, COLLECTING LAVAS, SEDIMENTS FROM OUTFLOW CHANNELS, AND ICE-MANTLED DEBRIS. BENEATH THE PRESENT-DAY SURFACE OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS, THERE IS THUS PRESERVED A LONG RECORD OF MARTIAN GEOLOGIC PROCESSES FROM THE EARLY NOACHIAN ONWARD; HOWEVER, THE DIFFICULTY OF FINDING WELL-EXPOSED OUTCROPS HAS HINDERED STUDIES OF NORTHERN PLAINS COMPOSITIONAL STRATIGRAPHY. NEW DATA NOW PERMIT SUCH INVESTIGATION. HIGH RESOLUTION DATA FROM THE COMPACT RECONNAISSANCE IMAGING SPECTROMETER FOR MARS (CRISM) SHOW THE NORTHERN PLAINS ARE COMPRISED OF COMPOSITIONALLY DIVERSE MATERIALS, IF BURIED STRATA CAN BE ACCESSED. IN ACIDALIA PLANITIA, SALVATORE ET AL. (2010) FOUND APPARENTLY UNALTERED MATERIALS BEARING OLIVINE AND LOW-CALCIUM PYROXENE, WHICH THEY INFERRED TO BE EXCAVATED HESPERIAN LAVAS, IN A STUDY OF CRATERS. CARTER ET AL. (2010), "DUG" STILL DEEPER, IDENTIFYING NINE LARGE (>20 KM) CRATERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN LOWLANDS THAT HOST DIVERSE HYDRATED SILICATES. THEY INFERRED THAT THESE RESULT FROM AN EXCAVATION OF A DEEPER, UNDERLYING NOACHIAN STRATIGRAPHIC LAYER. FINALLY, DISCUSSED HEREIN, NEW CRISM TARGETED DATA FROM HESPERIAN SEDIMENTARY UNITS NEAR THE CHRYSE/ACIDALIA PLANITIA DICHOTOMY BOUNDARY SHOW THAT SEVERAL MOUNDS AND INVERTED CHANNELS HAVE PHYLLOSILICATES ERODING FROM THEIR FLANKS. WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THE CHANGING NATURE OF AQUEOUS ALTERATION ON MARS BY STUDY OF THE DISTRIBUTION AND STRATIGRAPHY OF PHYLLOSILICATE BEARING MATERIALS WITHIN THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS WILL BE DONE BY MEANS OF THREE INVESTIGATIONS 1) A SYSTEMATIC SURVEY OF CRISM MULTISPECTRAL DATA TO MAP HYDRATED SILICATE DISTRIBUTION FROM THE DICHOTOMY BOUNDARY TO 60 N. WE WILL SEARCH FOR REGIONAL OR LATITUDINAL CONTROLS ON THE PREVALENCE OF ALTERATION MINERALS AND MINERAL PHASES FOUND. 2) A SYSTEMATIC STUDY OF SEVERAL DOZEN CRATERS (SIZE RANGE ~2-100KM) WITHIN THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO ASSESS THEIR MINERALOGY WITH CRISM HIGHEST-RESOLUTION TARGETED DATA IN CONJUNCTION WITH HIGH-RESOLUTION IMAGES (HIRISE, CTX, MOC). WE WILL USE THE SETTING OF ALTERED MATERIALS (EJECTA, WALLS, CENTRAL PEAK) AND PHYSICS-BASED CRATERING MODELS FOR DEPTH-DIAMETER AND DEPTH-DISTANCE RELATIONSHIPS TO DETERMINE THE LIKELY DEPTH AND CRUSTAL UNIT OF ORIGIN OF THE MATERIALS HOSTING HYDRATED SILICATES AND MAFIC MINERALS. THIS WILL PERMIT CONSTRUCTION OF LOCAL AND REGIONAL COMPOSITIONAL STRATIGRAPHIES. 3) A STUDY OF PHYLLOSILICATES HOSTED IN MOUNDS AND CHANNELS WITHIN SEDIMENTARY UNITS MAPPED AS HESPERIAN NEAR THE DICHOTOMY BOUNDARY IN CHRYSE/ACIDALIA. WE WILL STUDY THE MINERALOGY AND DISTRIBUTION OF THESE ALTERED MATERIALS WITH CRISM DATA, AND UTILIZE HIGH RESOLUTION HIRISE AND CTX IMAGES OF CONTACTS AND EXISTING GEOLOGIC MAPS TO ESTABLISH THE TIMING OF EMPLACEMENT. WE WILL TEST (I) WHETHER PHYLLOSILICATE DISTRIBUTION IN THE NORTHERN LOWLANDS IS CONSISTENT WITH EXCAVATION FROM A DEEP, ALTERED, POTENTIALLY NOACHIAN-AGED UNIT AND (II) WHETHER HESPERIAN MATERIALS WITH CRYSTALLINE HYDRATED SILICATES, BOTH EXCAVATED BY CRATERS AND FOUND IN ACIDALIA SEDIMENTS, MAY INDICATE MORE RECENT (HESPERIAN) AQUEOUS ALTERATION. WE EXPECT THAT THIS PROJECT WILL REFINE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE NATURE AND TIMING OF AQUEOUS ALTERATION ON EARLY MARS AND THE NATURE OF THE NORTHERN PLAINS.

doc.ContractDescription: IN ORDER TO UNDERSTAND HOW THE CLIMATE RESPONDS TO VARIATIONS IN FORCING, ONE NECESSARY COMPONENT IS TO UNDERSTAND THE FULL DISTRIBUTION OF VARIABILITY OF EXCHANGES OF HEAT AND MOISTURE BETWEEN THE ATMOSPHERE AND OCEAN. A NUMBER OF STUDIES RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANT ROLE OF SURFACE HEAT AND MOISTURE FLUXES IN THE GENERATION AND DECAY OF IMPORTANT COUPLED AIR-SEA PHENOMENA. THESE MECHANISMS OPERATE ACROSS A NUMBER OF SCALES AND CONTAIN SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTIONS FROM INTERACTIONS BETWEEN THE ANOMALOUS (I.E. NON-MEAN), OFTEN EXTREME-VALUED, FLUX COMPONENTS. IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE A CHARACTERIZATION AND UNDERSTANDING OF THESE PROCESSES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF ACCURATE MODELING EFFORTS. WE PROPOSE AN INTEGRATED APPROACH TOWARDS DETERMINING THE INTERACTION OF THE ATMOSPHERE AND THE OCEAN THROUGH THE SURFACE FLUXES OF HEAT AND MOISTURE, COMBINED WITH OTHER WEATHER PROPERTIES, ON A VARIETY OF SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL SCALES. IN PARTICULAR, WE ARE SEEKING TO UNDERSTAND THE VARIABILITY AND EXTREMES IN AIR-SEA FLUXES OF HEAT AND MOISTURE IN THE CONTEXT OF THE WATER AND ENERGY CYCLE, AND HOW THE ENTIRE DISTRIBUTION OF FLUXES VARIES OVER TIME, WITH LOCATION, AND WITH DIFFERING WEATHER AND CLIMATE STATES.

doc.ContractDescription: THE SUN'S SPIN AXIS AND THE PLANETS' ORBITAL AXES ARE NEARLY PARALLEL. ALTHOUGH MANY PEOPLE EXPECTED THAT EXOPLANETARY SYSTEMS WOULD ALSO BE WELL-ALIGNED, IN OUR PREVIOUS NASA ORIGINS PROGRAM WE DISCOVERED SEVERAL STRONGLY MISALIGNED SYSTEMS, INCLUDING ONE CASE OF AN APPARENTLY RETROGRADE ORBIT. WE NOW PROPOSE A CONTINUATION OF THIS PROGRAM, WITH THE GOALS OF MEASURING SPIN-ORBIT ANGLES FOR A LARGER AND MORE DIVERSE SAMPLE OF EXOPLANETS, AND GAINING A THEORETICAL UNDERSTANDING OF WHY SOME ORBITS ARE WELL-ALIGNED WITH THEIR HOST STARS AND OTHERS ARE TILTED. THE RESULTS WILL BE FUNDAMENTAL GEOMETRIC MEASUREMENTS OF EXOPLANETARY SYSTEMS, AND CRUCIAL CLUES THAT WILL HELP US SOLVE THE LONG-STANDING PROBLEMS OF THE ORIGIN OF ECCENTRIC ORBITS AND HOT JUPITERS. THESE GOALS ARE ALIGNED WITH THE NASA ORIGINS OBJECTIVES OF CHARACTERIZING EXOPLANETS AND UNDERSTANDING THE EVOLUTION OF PLANETARY SYSTEMS. OUR OBSERVING TECHNIQUE RELIES ON THE ROSSITER-MCLAUGHLIN EFFECT, A SPECTROSCOPIC ANOMALY THAT OCCURS DURING PLANETARY TRANSITS. WE WILL OBSERVE 20 EXOPLANETARY SYSTEMS USING THE KECK I TELESCOPE. WE WILL USE THE DATA TO TEST SPECIFIC PLANET MIGRATION THEORIES, WHICH DIFFER STRONGLY IN THEIR PREDICTIONS FOR THE PREVALENCE AND DEGREE OF SPIN-ORBIT MISALIGNMENTS. WE WILL ALSO PERFORM STATISTICAL ANALYSES TO DRAW MODEL-INDEPENDENT INFERENCES ABOUT SPIN-ORBIT ALIGNMENT. FUNDS ARE REQUESTED TO SUPPORT AN MIT POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE, A CALTECH GRADUATE STUDENT, AND ONE MONTH OF THE PI'S SUMMER SALARY.
IGF::OT::IGF CONDUCT ANALYSES OF TISSUE SAMPLES

doc.ContractDescription: WE PROPOSE TO CONDUCT MULTI-INSTRUMENT OBSERVATIONS OF THE LOW-LATITUDE IONOSPHERE TO ADDRESS TWO FUNDAMENTAL AREAS OF THERMOSPHERE-IONOSPHERE-MAGNETOSPHERE COUPLING PHYSICS: (1) TO UNDERSTAND THE CONTROL THAT THE ATMOSPHERE AND ITS DYNAMICS HAVE ON THE DAY-TO-DAY VARIABILITY AND THE LONGITUDINAL DEPENDENCE OF THE LOW-LATITUDE ELECTRODYNAMICS AND THE LARGE-SCALE STRUCTURING, AND (2) TO INVESTIGATE REGIONALLY THE MAIN SEEDING CONDITIONS FOR EQUATORIAL PLASMA BUBBLES AND SCINTILLATION ACTIVITIES IN AFRICA AND SOUTH AMERICA. THE PHYSICAL MECHANISMS THAT CAUSE LARGE-SCALE DENSITY IRREGULARITIES AND SCINTILLATIONS AT THE EQUATORIAL REGIONS ARE NOT YET FULLY UNDERSTOOD. ESPECIALLY, THE LONGITUDINAL VARIABILITY OF BUBBLE OCCURRENCE IS STILL AN OUTSTANDING QUESTION. THIS IS EVIDENT IN SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS THAT SHOW VERY UNIQUE AND MORE INTENSE EQUATORIAL ANOMALY STRUCTURES AND SCINTILLATION ACTIVITY IN THE AFRICAN REGION THAN ANY OTHER REGIONS. IN ADDITION, RECENT MEASUREMENTS OF TEC DEPLETIONS OVER SOUTH AMERICA HAVE REVEALED THAT USUALLY THEY OCCUR IN PATCHES EXTENDING FOR 100S OF KM, BUT QUITE OFTEN THEY OCCUPY THE WHOLE CONTINENT. THEREFORE, TO ADDRESS THE ABOVE FUNDAMENTAL PROBLEMS, DATA FROM SEVERAL DIFFERENT GROUND- AND SPACE-BASED INSTRUMENTS WILL BE UTILIZED. PAIRS OF MAGNETOMETERS IN THE AMERICAN AND AFRICAN SECTORS WILL BE USED TO ESTIMATE VERTICAL DRIFTS. DATA FROM ION VELOCITY METER (IVM) AND VECTOR ELECTRIC FIELD INSTRUMENT (VEFI) INSTRUMENTS ON BOARD C/NOFS WILL ALSO PROVIDE VERTICAL DRIFTS AT DIFFERENT ALTITUDES. SIMULTANEOUSLY, ACE SATELLITE DATA WILL HELP UNDERSTAND THE ROLE OF THE PENETRATION ELECTRIC FIELD, FOR PROCESSES GOVERNING EQUATORIAL IONOSPHERIC ELECTRODYNAMICS DURING STORM CONDITIONS. GPS RECEIVERS ON THE GROUND AND IN SPACE (LEO SATELLITES) WILL RESOLVE SPACE-TIME AMBIGUITY AND WILL BE ABLE TO TRACK THE EVOLUTION OF EQUATORIAL IONOSPHERIC IRREGULARITIES. NEW IONOSONDES RECENTLY INSTALLED IN THE AFRICAN AND SOUTH AMERICAN EQUATORIAL AND ANOMALY PEAK REGIONS WILL PROVIDE BOTTOM SIDE DENSITIES, DRIFTS NEAR SUNSET TIMES AND THE MERIDIONAL WINDS. THE PLP SENSOR ON C/NOFS AND THE DENSITY INSTRUMENT ON DMSP WILL GIVE INFORMATION ABOUT THE MAXIMUM PENETRATION ALTITUDE OF PLASMA BUBBLES. THIS 4-YEAR PROPOSAL AIMS TO USE THIS INSTRUMENTATION TO QUANTIFY THE EFFECT THAT THE UPPER THERMOSPHERE IN THE FORM OF PROPAGATING MIGRATING/NON-MIGRATING TIDES AND PLANETARY WAVES, ORIGINATED IN THE TROPOSPHERE, HAVE ON THE IONOSPHERIC DYNAMICS AND ON THE DEVELOPMENT AND DECAY OF PLASMA BUBBLES. THIS INVESTIGATION AIMS TO RELATE THE DAY-TO-DAY VARIABILITY OF F-REGION DYNAMICS TO THE VARIABILITY OF THE INPUTS FROM BELOW. THIS COMPLETE SPECIFICATION OF THE DRIVING WINDS WILL ALLOW US TO CALCULATE PLASMA DRIFTS FOR LONGITUDES AND TIMES THAT DO NOT HAVE DIRECT PLASMA DRIFT MEASUREMENTS. DURING DISTURBED CONDITIONS, THE MORE COMPLETE ASSESSMENT OF THE THERMOSPHERIC INPUTS IN TWO CONTINENTS (E.G. DISTURBED DYNAMO EFFECT) WILL MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO SINGLE OUT EFFECTS DUE TO PROMPT PENETRATION ELECTRIC FIELDS. WE WILL ALSO UTILIZE THE CAPABILITY OF EXISTENT GPS RECEIVERS AND IONOSONDES IN AFRICA AND SOUTH AMERICA TO OBSERVE GRAVITY WAVES (GW) AND STUDY THEIR SEEDING CONDITIONS IN THESE TWO CONTINENTS. BY ADOPTING AN OBSERVATIONAL STRATEGY RICH IN INSTRUMENTAL DIVERSITY AND A SCIENTIFIC INITIATIVE THAT SEEKS THE PRIMARY CAUSES OF THE DAY-TO-DAY VARIABILITY AND THE LONGITUDINAL DEPENDENCE OF THE OCCURRENCE OF THE PLASMA BUBBLES, WE WILL BE ADDRESSING THE FOCUSED SCIENCE TOPIC (A) LOW- TO MID-LATITUDE IONOSPHERIC IRREGULARITIES AND TURBULENCE.

doc.ContractDescription: 1ST QTR FY2016 MEAT ITEMS FCI TALLADEGA SEE ATTACHED SCHEDULE SUPPLIES/SERVICES
ALLIED VISION TECHNOLOGY MODEL MANTA G-235C COLOR CAMERA PLUS AVT MANTA TRIPOD MOUNT ADAPTER

WHEN SUPPORTING THE MULTI-DISCIPLINARY ANALYSIS AND DESIGN (MDAO) OF PHYSICALLY REALIZABLE OBJECTS, THE CREATION AND MODIFICATION OF GEOMETRY IS CRITICAL. IN THE PAST, MDAO FRAMEWORKS HAVE NOT EXPLICITLY TREATED GEOMETRY AND SO THERE IS NOTHING IN THE FRAMEWORK THAT ENSURES OR MAINTAINS GEOMETRIC CONSISTENCY AMONGST MODELS USED BY THE DISCIPLINES. FOR EXAMPLE, THE COUPLING TO HIGH FIDELITY AERODYNAMIC AND STRUCTURAL ANALYSES RELIES HEAVILY ON THE EXISTENCE OF A COMMON GEOMETRY FOR PASSING PERTINENT DATA. THIS LACK OF GEOMETRY AS A FIRST-CLASS OBJECT IN THESE SYSTEMS IS A FUNDAMENTAL LIMITATION FOR THE DESIGN OF MANY REAL-WORLD SYSTEMS. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROPOSED EFFORT IS TO PROVIDE THE TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES THAT ALLOW GEOMETRY TO TAKE A PIVOTAL POSITION WITHIN NASA'S OPENMDAO ARCHITECTURE. THIS WILL ENABLE USERS TO EMPLOY THE MOST COMMONLY USED SOLID MODELING SYSTEMS AND HAVE THE LOGIC WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK TO TRANSFER REQUISITE DATA FOR ITS APPLICATION WITHIN OTHER ANALYSIS MODULES. THE HEART OF THE PROPOSED EFFORT IS THE "GEOMETRY ENVIRONMENT FOR MDAO", OR GEM. THE FIRST ELEMENT OF GEM IS A DATA MODEL (CLASS DEFINITIONS) THAT ENCAPSULATES THREE TIGHTLY INTEGRATED REPRESENTATIONS OF A CONFIGURATION. THE THREE PROPOSED REPRESENTATIONS INCLUDE A MASTER MODEL (COMPRISED OF A FEATURE TREE AND ASSOCIATED DESIGN PARAMETERS), A BOUNDARY REPRESENTATION, OR BREP (WHICH DESCRIBES BOTH THE TOPOLOGY AND GEOMETRY OF THE CONFIGURATION), AND A DISCRETE REPRESENTATION (DREP) THAT IS PRESENTED AS A WATERTIGHT TESSELLATION. FULL ASSOCIATIVITY WILL BE MAINTAINED BETWEEN THESE THREE REPRESENTATIONS SO THAT DESIGN CHANGES CAN BE TRACKED AND MANAGED. THE SECOND ELEMENT OF GEM IS A SET OF 'METHODS' (OR API) THAT DESCRIBE THE TYPES OF OPERATIONS THAT CAN BE PERFORMED ON EACH GEM OBJECT. GEM WILL BE FULLY IMPLEMENTED IN PYTHON AND WILL BE TIGHTLY INTEGRATED WITH OPENMDAO'S ARCHITECTURE. TO ENSURE THAT GEM'S DESIGN IS COMPLETE, CONSISTENT, AND CORRECT, TWO IMPLEMENTATIONS WILL BE PRODUCED AS PART OF THE PROPOSED EFFORT. THE FIRST IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE A PROTOTYPE NAMED GEM/CAPRI THAT IS BUILT ON CAPRI. IN ADDITION TO ITS ROLE AS A PROTOTYPE, GEM/CAPRI WILL IMMEDIATELY GIVE USERS ACCESS TO SEVERAL COMMERCIALLY AVAILABLE CAD SYSTEMS AS WELL AS THE OPENCASCADE GEOMETRY KERNEL. THIS WILL ALLOW ORGANIZATIONS THAT ALREADY USE ONE OF THOSE CAD SYSTEMS TO (CONTINUE TO) USE CAPRI NATIVELY IN BOTH A STAND-ALONE MANNER AND AS A PART OF AN OPENMDAO PROCESS, PROVIDING A SINGLE AND CONSISTENT GEOMETRIC REPRESENTATION. THE SECOND IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE AN OPEN-SOURCE "SAMPLE IMPLEMENTATION OF GEM" (OR SIGEM), WHICH WILL BE DIRECTLY USABLE WITHOUT THE ENCUMBRANCE OF LICENSES; IT CAN ALSO BE USED AS AN EXAMPLE FOR DEVELOPERS WHO WANT TO USE A DIFFERENT OPEN OR PROPRIETARY SYSTEM THAT MAY REPRESENT OTHER VIEWS ON GEOMETRY CONSTRUCTION. IT IS EXPECTED THAT SIGEM WILL USE OPENCASCADE AND POSSIBLY FREECAD AS THE OPEN-SOURCE GEOMETRY KERNEL AND MASTER MODEL IMPLEMENTATIONS. OPENMDAO WILL THEN BE ABLE TO INTERROGATE THE DESIGN INTENT BY ACCESSING THE CONSTRUCTION RECIPE AND DRIVE THE DESIGN BY ADJUSTING PARAMETERS FROM MODELS BUILT IN AN OPEN-SOURCE SETTING. THE DEVELOPMENT OF GEM WILL BE DRIVEN BY A SERIES OF SCENARIOS THAT DESCRIBE THE BREADTH AND DEPTH OF GEOMETRIC TOOLS AND TECHNIQUES THAT ARE NEEDED BY OPENMDAO'S USER COMMUNITY. EACH YEAR, OPENMDAO SCRIPTS THAT IMPLEMENT THE APPROPRIATE SCENARIOS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED AND EVALUATED. IN ADDITION TO ANNUAL REPORTS AND PERIODIC TELECONFERENCES, THE DELIVERABLES FOR THE PROPOSED WORK INCLUDE THE COMPLETE DOCUMENTATION OF GEM AND ITS API, THE OPEN-SOURCE VERSION OF SIGEM, AND A SET OF OPENMDAO TUTORIALS THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCENARIOS DESCRIBED ABOVE.
doc.MajorAgency: GEOMETRY INTERFACE FOR THE NASA OPENMDAO FRAMEWORK

doc.ContractDescription: NEW TECHNOLOGY HAS RECENTLY MADE IT POSSIBLE TO MEASURE SOIL MOISTURE OVER THE FULL ROOT ZONE AT HIGH SPATIAL RESOLUTION USING SYNTHETIC APERTURE RADAR MEASUREMENTS AT ULTRA-LOW (P-BAND) FREQUENCIES. THE AIRBORNE MICROWAVE OBSERVATORY OF SUBCANOPY AND SOIL MOISTURE (AIRMOSS) WILL MAKE SUCH MEASUREMENTS THREE TIMES A YEAR FOR THREE YEARS OVER NINE NORTH AMERICAN SITES IN ORDER TO STUDY THE EFFECT OF SPATIAL VARIABILITY IN ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE ON NET ECOSYSTEM EXCHANGE. IT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THREE OF THE SIX SCIENCE FOCUS AREAS - WATER AND ENERGY CYCLES, CARBON CYCLE AND ECOSYSTEMS, AND WEATHER. MORE GENERALLY, REMOTELY SENSED MEASUREMENTS OF ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE ARE NECESSARY TO UNDERSTAND THE EFFECT OF GLOBAL CHANGE ON WEATHER AND CLIMATE AND ON RECHARGE RATES TO DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES FROM GROUNDWATER. THEREFORE, THEY DIRECTLY ADDRESS THE GOAL OF THE EARTH SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAM OF THE SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE TO 'UNDERSTAND HOW THE EARTH SYSTEM IS CHANGING AND UNDERSTAND CONSEQUENCES FOR LIFE ON EARTH.' RETRIEVAL OF SOIL MOISTURE FROM SAR DATA REQUIRES ACCURATE ACCOUNTING FOR THE EFFECTS OF SOIL ROUGHNESS AND VEGETATION ON THE MEASURED SIGNAL. THESE EFFECTS DEPEND ON A HIGH NUMBER OF ANCILLARY PARAMETERS THAT ARE DIFFICULT TO ESTIMATE A PRIORI AND MUST BE DETERMINED FROM MEASUREMENTS. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL COMBINE MEASUREMENTS ACROSS TIMESCALES AND ACROSS LANDSCAPE FEATURES TO CONSTRAIN THESE PARAMETERS AND THEREBY IMPROVE THE ACCURACY OF ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE ESTIMATES FROM AIRMOSS. MEASUREMENTS FROM DIFFERENT FLIGHT CAMPAIGNS OVER THE SAME AREA WILL BE COMBINED PROBABILISTICALLY TO ESTIMATE PARAMETERS OF ALLOMETRIC RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN DIFFERENT VEGETATION PROPERTIES. ALLOMETRIC PARAMETERS WILL ALSO BE CONSTRAINED ACROSS LANDSCAPE FEATURES BY COMPARING RESULTS FROM NEARBY PIXELS WITH THE SAME LAND COVER. LASTLY, SOIL MOISTURE CORRELATIONS FROM LAND SURFACE MODELS WILL BE USED AS INDICATORS FOR WHAT SPATIAL SOIL MOISTURE PATTERNS BETWEEN RETRIEVED VALUES MAY BE UNREALISTIC AND INDICATIVE OF RETRIEVAL ERRORS. THE RESULTING RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO ACCOUNT FOR VEGETATION AND SOIL ROUGHNESS, AND THUS BETTER ABLE TO ESTIMATE ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE. SINCE THE PROPOSED ALGORITHMS ARE PROBABILISTIC, THEY WILL ALLOW FOR EXPLICIT ESTIMATES OF MEASUREMENT UNCERTAINTY ALONG WITH THE IMPROVED ESTIMATES. THESE SHOULD BE USEFUL TO THE LAND SURFACE AND CLIMATE MODELING COMMUNITIES, WHICH COMMONLY USE STOCHASTIC METHODS.
doc.MajorAgency: ALGORITHMS FOR P-BAND SAR ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE
doc.MajorFundingAgency: ALGORITHMS FOR P-BAND SAR ROOT-ZONE SOIL MOISTURE

doc.ProductorServiceCode: J065: MAINT/REPAIR/REBUILD OF EQUIPMENT- MEDICAL, DENTAL, AND VETERINARY EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES

doc.ContractDescription: DUST PLAYS MANY IMPORTANT ROLES IN THE INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM (ISM) INCLUDING DETERMINING ITS THERMAL BALANCE, CHEMISTRY AND STAR FORMATION RATE. MODELS FOR DUST EVOLUTION HAVE CONSISTENTLY FOUND THAT THE DUST DESTRUCTION RATE IN THE ISM EXCEEDS THE CREATION RATE BY A SUBSTANTIAL FACTOR, MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO EXPLAIN WHY SUCH A LARGE FRACTION OF METALS APPEAR TO BE DEPLETED INTO DUST GRAINS. WE PROPOSE TO EXPLORE THE EVOLUTION OF DUST THROUGH TWO SETS OF INVESTIGATIONS. FIRST BY CARRYING OUT NUMERICAL HYDRODYNAMICAL CALCULATIONS OF SUPERNOVA REMNANT (SNR) EVOLUTION IN AN INHOMOGENEOUS ISM. THESE CALCULATIONS WILL ALLOW US RE-EVALUATE DUST DESTRUCTION RATES CAUSED BY SNR SHOCKS. SECONDLY WE WILL CARRY OUT MONTE CARLO CALCULATIONS OF DUST GRAINS OVER THEIR LIFETIMES IN THE ISM BY FOLLOWING THE GRAINS FROM THEIR POINT OF FORMATION THROUGH THEIR DESTRUCTION ALLOWING FOR THEIR EROSION, ACCRETION, AND OTHER EFFECTS AS THE ISM IN WHICH THEY ARE EMBEDDED CHANGES PHASE AND EXPERIENCES SHOCKS AND UV RADIATION FLUCTUATIONS. THESE CALCULATIONS AIM TO HELP US UNDERSTAND NOT JUST THE AVERAGE PROPERTIES OF DUST BUT ALSO THE RANGE OF PROPERTIES OF THE GRAINS AS INFERRED FROM OBSERVATIONS OF EXTINCTION, EMISSION AND DEPLETION OF ELEMENTS FROM THE GAS PHASE. OUR RESULTS WILL HAVE BROAD APPLICABILITY TO THE INTERPRETATION OF OBSERVATIONS IN THE INFRARED THROUGH THE ULTRAVIOLET AND OUR UNDERSTANDING OF GALACTIC EVOLUTION.
doc.MajorAgency: THE LIFE AND TIMES OF A DUST GRAIN: GLOBAL MODELS
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE LIFE AND TIMES OF A DUST GRAIN: GLOBAL MODELS

doc.ContractDescription: AT PRESENT, THE ONLY GROUP KNOWN TO BE IN THE PROCESS OF CONVERTING COLD GAS INTO A HOT X-RAY EMITTING INTRA-GROUP MEDIUM AND THUS STARVING STAR-FORMATION IN ITS MEMBER GALAXIES IS STEPHAN S QUINTET. THE NGC 5903/NGC 5898 GROUP MAY BE THE SECOND EXAMPLE. IT CONTAINS A 100 KPC HI FILAMENT AND A 65 KPC DIAMETER DIFFUSE RADIO STRUCTURE WHICH APPEAR TO BE ANTI-CORRELATED. A BRIGHT RIDGE IN THE RADIO STRUCTURE MAY BE A SHOCK DRIVEN BY A GALAXY/HI COLLISION, AS IN STEPHAN S QUINTET. ALTERNATIVELY THE RADIO EMISSION MAY BE A REMNANT OF OLD AGN ACTIVITY, BUT IN EITHER CASE THE GROUP SHOULD BE X-RAY LUMINOUS. A SHORT (50 KS) XMM-NEWTON OBSERVATION WILL ALLOW US TO DISCRIMINATE BETWEEN THE TWO SCENARIOS, AND EXAMINE HOW GROUPS FORM AND MAINTAIN THEIR HOT INTRA-GROUP MEDIUM.
doc.MajorAgency: THE ORIGIN OF THE DIFFUSE RADIO STRUCTURE AROUND N
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE ORIGIN OF THE DIFFUSE RADIO STRUCTURE AROUND N
